Key Arguments: The bill is compared to historical acts of censorship, such as book burning.
There is skepticism about who determines what constitutes misinformation or disinformation.
The submitter believes individuals should have the freedom to research and form their own opinions.
The bill is viewed as unnecessary and harmful to freedom of expression.
Notable Quotes: This bill is tantamount to ‘book burning’ in previous periods of our global history.
The most insidious and damaging disinformation is political diatribe that we are exposed to constantly, year after year.
This bill needs to be renamed THE CENSORSHIP BILL of COMMUNIST AUSTRALIA.
